episode_event_salon_pasiosalon_date_ch03: Oh. Hello there.

I don’t suppose you’re also on your way
home from work.

I’m finally done with today’s tasks.
What a relief.

I don’t understand people who want to work
all the time.

Even when I’m working, all I can think
about is other things, like what to eat
when I’m done.
(Ask if he ever thinks about his job.)

Of course, to some extent. Mistakes are a
pain to fix, after all.
(Ask if food is all he thinks about.)
I wish, but I do think about my job.
Mistakes are a pain to fix, after all.

It’s important to pretend you’re focused on
the surface.

Remember that. It’s a coping technique I
learned on the job.
It could come in handy when you’re an adult.
All this real talk is making me hungry.
Enough about work. Let’s talk about food.

People from various regions are gathered
here on Pasio.

So the cuisine here is diverse,
to accommodate a variety of tastes.

They have the usual popular dishes, but they
also rotate in new ones, and—
I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to go on like that.

The food here on Pasio is so tasty, I got
carried away.

If you’re interested, [Name:PlayerNickname ],
I could recommend a few restaurants.
Days later...
Well, this is a rarity.

I’m just living a simple, ordinary life,
yet here you are again.

I consider myself quite normal. Just another
average joe.

But ever since I arrived on Pasio, I’ve met
folks who have a special shine. Like Kabu,
for example.

They’re too extraordinary for a person like
me, but I keep running into them.
At first, I thought you were like that, too.
But now...
I suspect you might be more like me.

At least, that’s what I thought, seeing you
surrounded by all those exceptional people.

Tell me, [Name:PlayerNickname ]...
Isn’t it exhausting?
(Tell him it makes every day fun.)
I see.
(Admit it’s tough sometimes.)
So you feel it too?

I’d like to learn how you’re able to fit in
with such marvels.
Care to chat over dinner?
You will? Let’s go, then.
Oh, don’t worry about the bill.

I do earn a salary, after all. Consider it
thanks for letting me pick your brain.
But if you insist...

You can treat me to a meal when you’re
a working adult.
